IRI.description: Stands for Internationalized Resource Identifier which is an internet protocol standard that builds on the URI protocol, extending the set of permitted characters to include Unicode/ISO 10646.
IRI.name: IRI

abstractionLevel.description: Extend of simplification of physical, spatial, or temporal details or attributes in the study of objects or systems.
abstractionLevel.name: Abstraction level

acknowledgement.description: Offical declaration or avowal of appreciation of an act or achievement.
acknowledgement.name: Acknowledgement

additionalRemarks.description: Mention of what deserves additional attention or notice.
additionalRemarks.name: Additional remarks

affiliation.description: Declaration of a person being closely associated to an organization.
affiliation.name: Affiliation

age.description: Time of life or existance at which some particular qualification, capacity or event arises.
age.name: Age

ageCategory.description: Distinct life cycle class that is defined by a similar age or age range (developmental stage) within a group of individual beings.
ageCategory.name: Age category

algorithm.description: Procedure for solving a mathematical problem in a finite number of steps. Can involve repetition of an operation.
algorithm.name: Algorithm

anatomicalAxesOrientation.description: Relation between reference planes used in anatomy and mathematics.
anatomicalAxesOrientation.name: Anatomical axes orientation

anatomicalEntity.description: Physical component of a body, organ, or tissue.
anatomicalEntity.name: Anatomical entity

annotationSet.description: Collection of notes or markings, each added by way of comment or explanation.
annotationSet.name: Annotation set

applicationCategory.description: Distinct class that groups software programs which perform a similar task or set of tasks.
applicationCategory.name: Application category

associatedFileExtension.description: String of characters attached as suffix to the names of files of a particular format.
associatedFileExtension.name: Associated file extension

author.description: Writer or creator of a literary or creative work.
author.name: Author

awardNumber.description: Machine-readable identifier for a benefit that is conferred or bestowed on the basis of merit or need.
awardNumber.name: Award number

awardTitle.description: Human-readable identifier for a benefit that is conferred or bestowed on the basis of merit or need.
awardTitle.name: Award title

axesOrigin.description: Special point in a coordinate system used as a fixed point of reference for the geometry of the surrounding space.
axesOrigin.name: Axes origin

behavioralTask.description: Specific set of defined activities (or their absence) that should be performed (or avoided) by a subject.
behavioralTask.name: Behavioral task

bestViewPoint.description: Coordinate point from which you get the best view of something.
bestViewPoint.name: Best view point

biologicalSex.description: Differentiation of individuals of most species (animals and plants) based on the type of gametes they produce.
biologicalSex.name: Biological sex

category.description: Distinct class to which a group of entities or concepts with similar characteristics or attributes belong to.
category.name: Category

contactInformation.description: Any available way used to contact a person or business (e.g., address, phone number, email address, etc.).
contactInformation.name: Contact information

contributionType.description: Distinct class of what was given or supplied as a part or share.
contributionType.name: Contribution type

contributor.description: Legal person that gave or supplied something as a part or share.
contributor.name: Contributor

coordinatePoint.description: Pair or triplet of numbers defining the position in a particular two- or three dimensional plane or space.
coordinatePoint.name: Coordinate point

coordinateSpace.description: Two or three dimensional geometric setting.
coordinateSpace.name: Coordinate space

coordinates.description: Pair or triplet of numbers defining a location in a given coordinate space.
coordinates.name: Coordinates

copyright.description: Exclusive and assignable legal right of an originator to reproduce, publish, sell, or distribute the matter and form of a creative work for a defined time period.
copyright.name: Copyright

criteria.description: Aspects or standards on which a judgement or decision is based.
criteria.name: Criteria

criteriaQualityType.description: Distinct class that defines how the judgement or decision was made for a particular criteria.
criteriaQualityType.name: Criteria quality type

custodian.description: Legal person entrusted with guarding and maintaining property or records.
custodian.name: Custodian

deed.description: Formal legal document describing some legal transfer, bargain or contract.
deed.name: Deed

defaultImage.description: Two or three dimensional image that particluarly represents a specific coordinate space.
defaultImage.name: Default image

definedIn.description: Reference to the file instance or file bundle in which something is stored.
definedIn.name: Defined in

definition.description: Short, but precise statement of the meaning of a word, word group, sign or a symbol.
definition.name: Definition

description.description: Longer statement or account giving the characteristics of someone or something.
description.name: Description

developer.description: Legal person that develops computer software.
developer.name: Developer

device.description: Piece of equipment or mechanism (hardware) designed to serve a special purpose or perform a special function.
device.name: Device

digest.description: Summation or condensation of a body of information.
digest.name: Digest

digitalIdentifier.description: Digital handle to identify objects or legal persons.
digitalIdentifier.name: Digital identifier

electrodeContact.description: Not shielded part of a conductor that is used to establish electrical contact with a nonmetallic part of a circuit.
electrodeContact.name: Electrode contact

electrodes.description: Elements in a semiconductor device that emits or collects electrons or holes or controls their movements.
electrodes.name: Electrodes

email.description: Means or system for transmitting messages electronically.
email.name: Email

endDate.description: Point at which something terminates in time
endDate.name: End date

ethicsAssessment.description: Judgment about the applied principles of conduct governing an individual or a group.
ethicsAssessment.name: Ethics assessment

familyName.description: Name borne in common by members of a family.
familyName.name: Family name

fullDocumentation.description: Usually printed instructions, comments, and information for using a particular product.
fullDocumentation.name: Full documentation

fullName.description: Whole, non-abbreviated name of something or somebody.
fullName.name: Full name

funder.description: Legal person that provides money for a particular purpose.
funder.name: Funder

funding.description: Money provided by a legal person for a particular purpose.
funding.name: Funding

genotype.description: Genetic constitution of an individual or group.
genotype.name: Genotype

givenName.description: Name given to a person, including all potential middle names, but excluding the family name.
givenName.name: Given name

groupedBy.description: Reference to the aspect used to group something.
groupedBy.name: Grouped by

handedness.description: Tendency to use one hand rather than the other.
handedness.name: Handedness

hasAlternativeVersion.description: Reference to a particular form of something differing only in the format, but not the actual content.
hasAlternativeVersion.name: Has alternative version

hasFeature.description: Reference to a particular structure, form, or appearance of something or someone.
hasFeature.name: Has feature

hasParent.description: Reference to the source object or legal person.
hasParent.name: Has parent

hasRequirement.description: Something essential to the existence or occurrence of something else.
hasRequirement.name: Has requirement

hasSupplementVersion.description: Reference to a complementing form of something.
hasSupplementVersion.name: Has supplement version

hasVersion.description: Reference to variants of an original.
hasVersion.name: Has version

hash.description: Function that converts original data into a single value.
hash.name: Hash

holder.description: Legal person in possession of something.
holder.name: Holder

homepage.description: Central website of something or someone.
homepage.name: Homepage

hostedBy.description: Reference to an organization that provides facilities and services for something.
hostedBy.name: Hosted by

howToCite.description: Preferred format for citing a particular object or legal person.
howToCite.name: How to cite

identifier.description: Term or code used to identify something or someone.
identifier.name: Identifier

identifierPattern.description: Format of a term or code used to identify something or someone.
identifierPattern.name: Identifier pattern

identifierSchema.description: Service institution providing particular formatted identifier for something or someone.
identifierSchema.name: Identifier schema

input.description: Something or someone that is put into or participates in a process or machine.
input.name: Input

inputData.description: Data that is put into a process or machine.
inputData.name: Input data

inputFormat.description: Format of data that is put into a process or machine.
inputFormat.name: Input format

internalIdentifier.description: Term or code that identifies someone or something within a particular product.
internalIdentifier.name: Internal identifier
